{{main|Bioethics|Medical ethics}}
    −
One of the major areas where ethicists practice is in the field of [[health care]]. This includes [[medicine]], [[nursing ethics|nursing]], [[pharmacy]], [[genetics]], and other [[allied health professions]]. Example issues are [[euthanasia]], [[animal testing]], [[abortion]], [[medical research]], [[vaccine trials]], [[stem cell research]], [[informed consent]], [[truth|truth telling]], [[human rights|patient rights]] and [[Wiktionary:autonomy|autonomy]], [[rationing]] of health care (such as [[triage]]).
+
One of the major areas where ethicists practice is in the field of [[health care]]. This includes [[medicine]], [[nursing ethics|nursing]], [[pharmacy]], [[genetics]], and other [[allied health professions]]. Example issues are [[euthanasia]], [[animal testing]], [[abortion]], [[medical research]], [[vaccine trials]], [[stem cell research]], [[informed consent]], [[truth|truth telling]], [[human rights|patient rights]] and [[Wiktionary:autonomy|autonomy]], [[rationing]] of health care (such as [[triage]]).Ethics is the base for all sorts of careers in the feild of health care.
